page.title: 08EASTHAM COUNTRY PARK.
page.content: Eastham Country Park was opened on July 10 1973.4,000 tons of rubbish was moved to make this sight.Also 80 acres were planted and 2,400 trees where planted to make this woodland forest. Records show that there was a Ferry service from Eastham.It was as long as 1509.That is the sandbanks wondered,due to the siltin up of the river,the starting point of the Ferry was changed several times. Before Eastham Country Park was built it used to be a barn for horses.A few years later the barns for the horses were converted into a zoo.There was a bear pit which you can still see now and a tree changed into a monkey swing.There are also rabbits which are quite common in and around the park.The badger is an animal which isn't often seen in the park.The grey
